headline: Primary Battles on the Right? They Seem Less So in Trump’s G.O.P.
abstract: With Republicans now unified, it is difficult to find a district where a challenger can credibly claim that the incumbent has been insufficiently supportive of the president.
lead_paragraph: DOYLESTOWN, Pa. — The scene was almost quaint, this cowboy-hatted neophyte preaching his gospel as about 15 supporters, peering out from snow-drenched hoodies, nodded along. Glimpsed from afar, it seemed a reminder that even in 2020, politics still boils down to this: small-town voters braving the elements to listen to an underdog candidate speak truth to power.
keywords: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
